hypothesis_content.title: Fading News-Driven Spikes in Low-Volume Environments
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC experiences a sharp price spike (>3% in 2 hours) coinciding with major news headlines during low volume periods (hourly volume below 30-day median), a fade of the initial move will be profitable within 12 hours as the emotional reaction dissipates.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Low volume amplifies news impact but lacks sustained participation. Initial emotional reaction often overstates the news' true market impact, leading to quick retracement as cooler heads prevail and liquidity providers fade the move.
entry_conditions: Current hourly volume < 30-day median hourly volume
Major news headline detected via news API in past 2 hours
Enter counter-trade (fade the spike) on close of the 2H candle that triggered the condition

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 50% of the initial 2H spike
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price extends another 2% beyond the initial spike extreme

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If the initial spike continuation occurs in >55% of cases (i.e., fade loses more often than wins) when tested across multiple news events.
